t: Jeremiah 6
Destruction of Jerusalem Impending

“Flee*pn for safety, O sons of Benjamin, From*ln the midst of Jerusalem! Now*ln blow a trumpet in Tekoa And*ln raise a signal over Beth-haccerem; For*ln evil looks down from the north, And*ln a great destruction.
The*ln comely and dainty one, the daughter of Zion, I will cut off.
Shepherds*ln and their flocks will come to her, They*ln will pitch their*i tents around her, They*ln will pasture each in his place.
Prepare*ln war against her; Arise,*ln and let us attack at noon. Woe*ln to us, for the day declines, For*ln the shadows of the evening lengthen!
Arise,*ln and let us attack by night And*ln destroy her palaces!”
For*ln thus says the Lord*s of hosts, “Cut*ln down her trees And*ln cast up a siege against Jerusalem. This*ln is the city to be punished, In*ln whose midst there is only oppression.
As*ln a well keeps its waters fresh, So*ln she keeps fresh her wickedness. Violence*ln and destruction are heard in her; Sickness*ln and wounds are ever before Me.
Be*ln warned, O Jerusalem, Or*ln I shall be alienated from you, And*ln make you a desolation, A*ln land not inhabited.”
Thus*ln says the Lord*s of hosts, “They*ln will thoroughly glean as the vine the remnant of Israel; Pass*ln your hand again like a grape gatherer Over*ln the branches.”

To*ln whom shall I speak and give warning That*ln they may hear? Behold,*ln their ears are closed And*ln they cannot listen. Behold,*ln the word of the Lord*s has become a reproach to them; They*ln have no delight in it.

But*ln I am full of the wrath of the Lord;*s I*ln am weary with holding it*i in. “Pour*ln it*i out on the children in the street And*ln on the gathering of young men together; For*ln both husband and wife shall be taken, The*ln aged and the very old.
Their*ln houses shall be turned over to others, Their*ln fields and their wives together; For*ln I will stretch out My hand Against*ln the inhabitants of the land,” declares the Lord.*s
“For*ln from the least of them even to the greatest of them, Everyone*ln is greedy for gain, And*ln from the prophet even to the priest Everyone*ln deals falsely.
They*ln have healed the brokenness of My people superficially, Saying,*ln ‘Peace, peace,’ But*ln there is no peace.

Were*ln they ashamed because of the abomination they have done? They*ln were not even ashamed at all; They*ln did not even know how to blush. Therefore*ln they shall fall among those who fall; At*ln the time that I punish them, They*ln shall be cast down,” says the Lord.*s

Thus*ln says the Lord,*s “Stand*ln by the ways and see and ask for the ancient paths, Where*ln the good way is, and walk in it; And*ln you will find rest for your souls. But*ln they said, ‘We will not walk in*i it.’*i
And*ln I set watchmen over you, saying,*i ‘Listen*ln to the sound of the trumpet!’ But*ln they said, ‘We will not listen.’
Therefore*ln hear, O nations, And*ln know, O congregation, what is among them.
Hear,*ln O earth: behold, I am bringing disaster on this people, The*ln fruit of their plans, Because*ln they have not listened to My words, And*ln as for My law, they have rejected it also.
For*ln what purpose does frankincense come to Me from Sheba And*ln the sweet cane from a distant land? Your*ln burnt offerings are not acceptable And*ln your sacrifices are not pleasing to Me.”

Therefore,*ln thus says the Lord,*s “Behold,*ln I am laying stumbling blocks before this people. And*ln they will stumble against them, Fathers*ln and sons together; Neighbor*ln and friend will perish.”
The Enemy from the North
Thus*pn says the Lord,*s “Behold,*ln a people is coming from the north land, And*ln a great nation will be aroused from the remote parts of the earth.

They*ln seize bow and spear; They*ln are cruel and have no mercy; Their*ln voice roars like the sea, And*ln they ride on horses, Arrayed*ln as a man for the battle Against*ln you, O daughter of Zion!”
We*ln have heard the report of it; Our*ln hands are limp. Anguish*ln has seized us, Pain*ln as of a woman in childbirth.
Do*ln not go out into the field And*ln do not walk on the road, For*ln the enemy has a sword, Terror*ln is on every side.
O*ln daughter of my people, put on sackcloth And*ln roll in ashes; Mourn*ln as for an only son, A*ln lamentation most bitter. For*ln suddenly the destroyer Will*ln come upon us.
“I*ln have made you an assayer and*i a tester among My people, That*ln you may know and assay their way.”
All*ln of them are stubbornly rebellious, Going*ln about as a talebearer. They*iln are*i bronze and iron; They,*ln all of them, are corrupt.
The*ln bellows blow fiercely, The*ln lead is consumed by the fire; In*ln vain the refining goes on, But*ln the wicked are not separated.
They*ln call them rejected silver, Because*ln the Lord*s has rejected them.
